      Returns:

    • endingGameExists

      public boolean endingGameExists(Game game)
      > This function checks if the ending of a game exists in the database
      Parameters:
      game - the game that we want to check if it has an ending
      Returns:
      The number of rows in the database that match the game.

    • getBeginningOfGame

      public Optional<Time> getBeginningOfGame(Game game)
      "Get the beginning of the game, if it exists." The function is a query to the database, and the query returns a list of GameStatus objects. If the list is empty, then the game has not started yet. If the list is not empty, then the game has started, and the first element of the list is the beginning of the game
      Parameters:
      game - The game you want to get the beginning of.
      Returns:
      Optional

    • getMostRecentEventTimeOfGame

      public Optional<Time> getMostRecentEventTimeOfGame(Game game, Time firstEvent)
      > Given a game and a time, return the most recent event time of the game, or the first event time of the next day if it exists
      Parameters:
      game - The game you want to get the most recent event time of.
      firstEvent - The first event of the game.
      Returns:
      The most recent event time of a game.

    • getMostRecentEventOfGame

      public Optional<GameEvent> getMostRecentEventOfGame(Game game)
      > Get the most recent event of a game, or if there are no events, get the first event of the next day
      Parameters:
      game - the game you want to get the most recent event of
      Returns:
      The most recent event of a game.

    • getChronologicEvents

      public List<GameEvent> getChronologicEvents(Game game)
      "Get the events and return them in chronological order." The first thing we do is get the beginning of the game. If we can't find it, we return an empty list
      Parameters:
      game - the game you want to get the events for
      Returns:
      A list of events that are happening today and tomorrow.

    • deleteEvent

      public boolean deleteEvent(int id)
      > If the event exists, delete it
      Parameters:
      id - the id of the event to be deleted
      Returns:
      A boolean value.

    • hasRedCard

      public boolean hasRedCard(Game game, Player player)
      "Return true if the player has a red card in the game." The function is annotated with @Transactional, which means that the function is executed in a transaction
      Parameters:
      game - The game in which the player has a red card
      player - the player who is being checked for a red card
      Returns:
      The number of red cards a player has in a game.

    • validateCard

      public boolean validateCard(Time dateAndTime, Game game, boolean isYellow, Player player)
      If the player has a red card, return false. If the player has a yellow card and the new card is yellow, add a red card. If the player has less than two yellow cards, return true
      Parameters:
      dateAndTime - The time of the event
      game - The game in which the card was given
      isYellow - true if the card is yellow, false if it's red
      player - The player who received the card
      Returns:
      A boolean value.

    • getPlayerStatistic

      public int[] getPlayerStatistic(Player p)
      Get the number of goals, yellow cards and red cards for a given player.
      Parameters:
      p - the player whose statistics are to be retrieved
      Returns:
      An array of integers.
